title: SPOT: Sequential Predictive Modeling of Clinical Trial Outcome with Meta-Learning. (arXiv:2304.05352v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Clinical trials are essential to drug development but time-consuming, costly, and prone to failure. Accurate trial outcome prediction based on historical trial data promises better trial investment decisions and more trial success. Existing trial outcome prediction models were not designed to model the relations among similar trials, capture the progression of features and designs of similar trials, or address the skewness of trial data which causes inferior performance for less common trials.  To fill the gap and provide accurate trial outcome prediction, we propose Sequential Predictive mOdeling of clinical Trial outcome (SPOT) that first identifies trial topics to cluster the multi-sourced trial data into relevant trial topics. It then generates trial embeddings and organizes them by topic and time to create clinical trial sequences. With the consideration of each trial sequence as a task, it uses a meta-learning strategy to achieve a point where the model can rapidly adapt to new t

Title: SPOT: Sequential Predictive Modeling of Clinical Trial Outcome with Meta-Learning. (arXiv:2304.05352v1 [cs.LG])
Abstract: Clinical trials are essential to drug development but time-consuming, costly, and prone to failure. Accurate trial outcome prediction based on historical trial data promises better trial investment decisions and more trial success. Existing trial outcome prediction models were not designed to model the relations among similar trials, capture the progression of features and designs of similar trials, or address the skewness of trial data which causes inferior performance for less common trials.  To fill the gap and provide accurate trial outcome prediction, we propose Sequential Predictive mOdeling of clinical Trial outcome (SPOT) that first identifies trial topics to cluster the multi-sourced trial data into relevant trial topics. It then generates trial embeddings and organizes them by topic and time to create clinical trial sequences. With the consideration of each trial sequence as a task, it uses a meta-learning strategy to achieve a point where the model can rapidly adapt to new t
translated_abstract: 临床试验虽然对药物研发至关重要，但耗时耗资，容易失败。基于历史试验数据进行准确的试验结果预测，可以更好地决策试验投资并提高试验成功率。现有的试验结果预测模型没有设计用于模拟相似试验之间的关系，不能捕捉相似试验特征和设计的进化，也不能解决造成少见试验性能较差的试验数据偏斜问题。为了填补这一空白并提供更准确的试验结果预测，本文提出了基于元学习的临床试验结果的序列预测建模（SPOT），首先识别试验主题，将多源试验数据聚集成相关的试验主题。然后生成试验嵌入，按主题和时间组织它们，创建临床试验序列。考虑到每个试验序列都是一个任务，采用元学习策略实现点，使模型能够快速适应新的试验序列。
tldr: SPOT是一种基于元学习的序列预测建模，可以在临床试验中对试验结果进行快速准确预测，解决数据偏斜问题。
en_tdlr: SPOT is a meta-learning-based sequential predictive modeling technique that solves the problem of data skewness and can rapidly and accurately predict clinical trial outcomes.
